intro: Notopleura sanblasensis, commonly known as the San Blas sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of San Blas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are small and typically pink or white, clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats.
